response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: You need to define the iterator() method in your LinkedList class that returns an instance of your custom iterator class. The custom iterator class should implement the Iterator interface and define the hasNext(), next(), and remove() methods.

For example, you could define your custom iterator class as follows:
```kotlin
class LinkedListIterator implements Iterator<T> {
    private Node<T> current;

    public LinkedListIterator(Node<T> head) {
        current = head;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        return current != null;
    }

    @Override
    public T next() {
        if (hasNext()) {
            return current.data;
        } else {
            throw new NoSuchElementException();
        }
    }

    @Override
    public void remove() {
        if (hasNext()) {
            current.previous.next = current.next;
            current.next.previous = current.previous;
            current = null;
        } else {
            throw new NoSuchElementException();
        }
    }
}
```
Then, in your LinkedList class, you can define the iterator() method as follows:
```scss
@Override
public Iterator<T> iterator() {
    return new LinkedListIterator(front);
}
```
This will allow you to use the Iterator interface to iterate over the elements of your LinkedList.
